channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Social care tax rise: MPs to hold Commons vote later
item.description: Boris Johnson says plan to raise National Insurance by 1.25 percentage points is "reasonable and fair".

item.title: No parental leave ‘a barrier’ to local politics
item.description: Campaigners say about three quarters of councils in England do not have a formal parental leave policy.

item.title: Channel crossings: Priti Patel to meet French minister over migrants
item.description: The home secretary has warned she could withhold a £54m payment to France unless more boats are stopped.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses: Archive found on 40th anniversary
item.description: Negatives from the classic sitcom found in the BBC Archives have been restored and digitised.

item.title: Crimewatch to show reconstruction of Sami Sidhom death
item.description: Crimewatch is broadcasting a reconstruction of the night Sami Sidhom was killed.

item.title: Woman refused 5pm finish wins £185,000 payout
item.description: Alice Thompson was awarded £185,000 after being told she could not work shorter hours to pick up her child.

item.title: HS2: Anglo-Saxon church found at Stoke Mandeville excavation site
item.description: Archaeologists make the discovery while digging at the site of a Norman church on the rail route.

item.title: Birmingham pub bombings: Campaigners on trial over lockdown memorial rally
item.description: Four people are on trial for non-payment of fines issued at the commemorative event.

item.title: CCTV shows 'idiotic' drive down Birmingham rail tracks
item.description: Aaron O'Halloran causes eight-hour passenger delays with his half-mile car ride between stations.

item.title: Ed Sheeran donates £10K to friend's hospice appeal
item.description: Ed Sheeran spent three years supporting Leamington Spa-based Nizlopi when he was a teenager.

item.title: Leamington Spa fire: Tributes to worker presumed dead
item.description: Police name the missing man as David Boswell who will be sorely missed, his parents say.

item.title: Motor neurone disease: Fundraising friends raise thousands for charity
item.description: Phil Rossall and Marcus Green raise money for charity through running and blinking challenges.

item.title: Dartmoor tor conquered with rescue team's help
item.description: Gilby Taylor has longed wanted to visit the summit of a Dartmoor tor near his home.

item.title: 'Why not have festivals that only women can attend?'
item.description: The idea for the three-day LBTQ Femme Fest was conceived on social media during lockdown.

item.title: Meteor caught on camera over Southampton docks
item.description: The shooting star was captured on camera over Southampton docks on Sunday night.

item.title: Should Whitehaven's planned coal mine be allowed?
item.description: Whitehaven residents share their thoughts on what could become the UK's first deep mine in 30 years.

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: US Open: Emma Raducanu set for Belinda Bencic quarter-final in New York
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu says her stunning run to the US Open quarter-finals is "surreal", putting her success down to feeling "really, really happy".

item.title: 'We can't let our guard down' - Southgate warns against England complacency
item.description: England boss Gareth Southgate wants to maintain their 100% record in World Cup qualifying against Poland on Wednesday.

item.title: Manchester United: Jesse Lingard rejects new deal
item.description: England forward Jesse Lingard rejects a contract offer from Manchester United.

item.title: Six Premier League clubs 'need to know' if their Brazilians will be suspended
item.description: The six Premier League clubs who refused to release players for Brazil's World Cup qualifiers "need to be told" in the next 24 hours if they are suspended for matches this weekend.

item.title: England U21 2-0 Kosovo U21: Lee Carsley wins his first game in charge of Young Lions
item.description: Manchester City's Cole Palmer scores on his debut as Lee Carsley's reign gets off to a winning start with victory against Kosovo in a Euro U21 qualifier.
